item.title: Drainage | Ron Lam calls for unification of the legislation
item.description: Deputy Ron Lam defended the unification of the legislation on water drainage in the territory, according to the newspaper or Mun. According to the publication in Chinese language, the deputy considers the unification of the drainage daughters -in -law. Macao Water Water and Drainage Regulation has been in force for over 40 years. Ron Lam justified the position with the need to adopt more demanding standards regarding the drainage of wastewater treatment stations, due to the complaints of Colaane residents of the odors issued by the unit operating in the village. For the deputy, the lack of unification of drainage standards and the outdated content of the water and wastewater drainage regulation make legal requirements not to respond to the environmental protection needs of a modern society. In addition, Ron Lam pointed out that more than half of wastewater is drained by wastewater treatment stations in Macau without receiving a secondary treatment. This option means that before it is returned to the sea, water goes through the treatment of slag separation. The deputy warned that treatment cannot only depend on dilution to reduce the impact of pollution, because the practice impairs the environment.

item.title: AL | Legislative elections scheduled for September 14
item.description:
The chief executive yesterday marked the day of legislative elections for September 14. The limit of the expenses of each application was set at more than 3.5 million patacas. The election campaign starts at the end of August, according to instructions from the Electoral Commission released yesterday
Sam Hou Fai yesterday marked the elections that will determine the cast of deputies of the eighth legislature of the Legislative Assembly. September 14 was the date chosen, according to the executive order signed by the chief executive, published yesterday in the official bulletin. In a separate order, Sam Hou Fai has set the maximum limit of expenses that each application can spend on the elections by nearly 3.55 million. Yesterday was also marked by the meeting of the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal), and subsequent publication of the instructions for the suffrage that establishes the following rules during the election campaign, which starts at midnight on August 30 and ends on September 12. The instructions published by Caeal on its official page also establish the voting methods, the duty of neutrality and impartiality of public entities and equivalent entities. This duty of neutrality and impartiality has been in force since yesterday and has to be respected by administration bodies, legal persons of public law, society with public capital, as well as the concessionaires, who are prohibited from favoring or impairing candidates for elections. Caeal indicates that those who break these duties in the performance of their duties can be penalized with three years in prison or fine up to 360 days. It is necessary to look Yesterday, during a press conference, Caeal President Seng Ioi Man stressed the importance of activities organized by candidacies associations could not mention electoral information, or campaign political proposals. Even though during these activities they are distributed gifts, memories, supermarket discount vouchers, candidates can participate in these events, provided that no election or campaign is discussed. At the same time, the corruption commissioner's deputy, Wong Kim Kim Fong, said, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, that legislative elections are one of this year's most important tasks of the corruption committee. The official also revealed that a 24 -hour line will open and an online platform to submit election complaints. Electoral patriotism Next Thursday, CAEAL will make available for the forms to build applications and, from there begins the deadline to submit the candidacy committees, which ends on June 6. During this period, Caeal will evaluate the legality of the process and will be given a week to "supply existing deficiencies." The president of Caeal pointed out yesterday that this is the first after the amendments to the law that regulates the elections for the Legislative Assembly, according to the principles of national security. As such, the legislative act “is of great importance”. Thus, Seng Ioi Man has ensured that Caeal "will consciously implement the principle of Macao governed by Patriots", "promoting several high quality electoral works, creating a fairer, equitable and clean environment for elections, and ensuring that elections are completed in a harmonious and ordained manner." The official assured that Caeal will decide whether candidates are eligible to run for elections, in accordance with the opinion of the State Security Defense Commission, which is advised by members of the Central Popular Government's Board of Cabinet.

item.title: Integration | Member of CCPPC wants Macao buses in Hengqin
item.description:
Lee Chong Cheng wants to facilitate circulation to the mountain island to bring more residents to the in -depth cooperation zone. In turn, businessman Frederico MA defends the diversification of hengqin, which he considers very dependent on the Chimelong Park
Macao member at the National Committee of the Chinese Political Advisory Conference (CCPPC) Lee Chong Cheng advocates the circulation of Macao's public buses on Mountain Island to make life easier for residents. The desire was expressed in statements to the newspaper or Mun, before Lee Chong Cheng travels to Beijing, where you will participate in the "two meetings." From the perspective of the president of the Macao Workers' Associations Federation, if buses can circulate between Macau and Hengqin, the will of residents of moving to the other side of the border will increase "significantly." Currently, to move to Mountain Island, residents need to take transport from Macau to the border. Once on the other side of the border, they can resort to taxis or the public transport network of Hengqin. Lee wants Macau's buses to come directly on Mountain Island without changing transportation. To promote hengqin circulation, Lee Chong Cheng also expects central authorities to make changes to the circulation of private cars on the border. Lee suggests more flexibility of border passage procedures, so that special needs passengers are not required to get out of vehicles. Currently, people over 70 years old, or less than 10, pregnant and disabled, may remain inside the car during border inspection. According to the Faom leader, the conditions should be more flexible to cover people 60 or older, young people up to 15 years old, and for those seeking medical care. As for the current measure of circulation of Macao vehicles in Guangdong Province, Lee Chong Cheng expects central government authorities to establish a specific corridor on the border only for Macao cars during weekends and holidays. Currently, the corridor is shared with Hong Kong vehicles. Industrial expansion In turn, Frederico Ma, also a member of Macau at CCPPC, considers that Macau and Hengqin should take advantage of the synergies to promote the entry of more mashed industries in the cooperation zone. In addition, the official who also chairs the Macau Commercial Association recalled that the development of hengqin tourism must be diversified, as all tourist attractions are currently passing through the Chimelong theme park and hotel. Frederico MA argues that Hengqin cannot depend on a single project, and advocates greater industrial development of hengqin, to take advantage of local advantages and diversify the economy. As an option for diversification, Frederico MA defends the bet on hengqin acupuncture, considering that it is an increasingly adopted practice by athletes in international sports competitions.

item.title: Improve the economy of Macau (II)
item.description: Last week, we analyzed the issue of directing visitors from traditional tourist attractions to community zones, thus increasing local commerce revenues in areas where residents live their daily lives. Thus, more people could benefit from tourists consumption and the number of stores closed could be reduced. For this plan to be successful, we must start receiving concerts and create careers of tourist buses between the show rooms and the community tourist areas. Concert organizers will have to sign contracts with the artists. If there is more than an artist to act, contracts should be signed with each of them. The Macao society should decide whether buses will be assigned by local transport companies or other companies. The company that is in charge of this service must decide whether or not the trips will be free. With tourist buses make the connecting places of concerts and community tourism areas, tourists can easily be transported. As we mentioned, these places are located in the areas where residents live their daily lives. Originally, these places were not considered touristy. Therefore, the first task is to attract tourists to these areas and the second is to take them to shop at local stores. This second question will have to be addressed and resolved by interested traders. Most of the products in Macau stores come from Zhuhai, Zhongshan and other places. Currently, most tourists visiting Macau and Hong Kong come from the interior of China. If we forward tourists from the Great Bay area to the community zones and expect you to shop at local stores we will not be very successful because the products that are there for sale are available in the cities where they reside. Also, these products are more expensive in Macau than in the Great Bay area and no one will want to buy at higher prices which can buy cheaper. It should be not to forget that since the movement known as “the cars that go north”, that is, the mass travel of residents of Macao to shop in the cities near the interior of China, local consumption has fallen significantly. This was also one of the reasons for reducing local consumption. It is not surprising that the fall in consumption has resulted in the end of several stores that were unable to pay the rentals. There is only one way to solve the problem that residents leave the city to shop and also take tourists from the interior of China to consume in community areas, and this has higher quality products, innovating and courage to look for change. There is a famous hot pot restaurant in mainland China. When it opened, it was just a small unknown store. Later, as the business flourished, they were increasingly opening branches. Hot Pot's restaurant was diversifying its offer and started selling its products in supermarkets, packed in plastic boxes that contained everything that was needed to heat the meals. It was a portable hot pot. Customers can purchase the meal without having to move to the restaurant. Also, when people go to hot pot restaurants are impregnated with a strong odor from meals. This chain has created a head washing service so that the odor disappears. All of these services have to do with "innovation." In management, there is a theory that advocates the innovation of companies. If our company stagnates, but our competitors evolve, it means that others change until us. If our competitor is better, we will be eliminated. In addition to bravely looking for change, the type of products sold should also be adjusted. Tourists in the Great Bay area do not easily buy products they can purchase at home. However, if the products sold in Macau stores have Portuguese elements that represent the cultural fusion of Macao, they will become more attractive. Macao young products such as hand and t-shirts reflect the mindset of local youth and are a symbol of their way of being in life, which is precisely what adherents of immersive tourism are looking for. Many of the Imanes for refrigerators sold in stores represent macao tourist sites. What if instead we would make i imans with specialties from Macau? When tourists see these images in their refrigerators, they will naturally remember the time they have spent in Macao. They will again evoke these flavors and revive their memories, which will always be fresh. To summarize, creating a special bus career to get the public from the concerts to consume in community zones is a strategy that is worth trying. But it is essential that stores in these zones have the courage to change and provide unique and good quality products and services. Only in this way can trade truly benefit from the visit of tourists. Tourists consumption in community zone stores is particularly important. This consumption represents recipes for stores. As these revenues increase, taxes that will pay the government will also increase. The Macao government can have more revenues creating new taxes. This way we can enjoy the benefits of "a visa for multiple purposes." In this sense, the whole society of Macau can profit. item.title: Couple therapy or love in the storm
item.description: Now I work as a couple therapist, a dream that has long wanted to realize. My understanding is no longer based only on countless readings, but also on direct experience with the conflict of couples. I leave that these experiences resonate in my knowledge and my therapeutic practice, in the hope that they result in richer reflections in this space of writing. Today I want to tell you about love in the storm. A love relationship presupposes an affective bond. We can discuss the many possible forms of “couple”, but I invite you to focus on the idea of ​​two people who find themselves and seek to connect through what they are in the most intimate and deep. Usually, in this kind of relationship, there is sex - the mechanism of connection par excellence, which brings us to our most primary desires. Theory suggests that we choose our partners because they fit the long history of our affective connections, starting with the most primary relationships, such as our parents. Thus, we establish romantic bonds that, while offering the possibility of emotional reparation, also feed our dysfunctions. Love does not exist without this polarity. The bond lives in the tension between finding the love of our lives and the risk of this same love becoming in our greatest enemy. This is, of course, a caricature, but I want them to be aware of this duality. It is common for couples, when they become aware of this tension, seek therapy. Then comes an distressing question: How can the person who love to awaken me so much sadness, anger or frustration? It is the very evolution of the relationship that leads to these winding paths. Our beliefs, the way they shape our behavior and even our understanding of romantic love influence the way we deal with this ambivalence. The truth is that we have prepared little for this reality. Recently, a husband in deep anguish shared with me: “I didn't betray, nor walk behind anyone. I don't realize why we are like this. ” In couple therapy, the goal is not to eliminate the conflict, but to understand it. The mismatch is inevitable, which is why tools are sought to better deal with it. One of the pillars of this process is to create a space where one can talk frankly about the challenges of the relationship. However, this mismatch is emotionally charged and not always easy to resolve. It is not enough to offer a new map for the couple to follow a different path. It is not even the therapist's role to give simple solutions. To reconstruct a relationship, it is necessary to face a storm - uncontrolled rainwater, wind at 100 km/h and deafening thunder. The therapist helps navigate this storm so that the couple understands that love contains in itself this disruptive possibility. Deep down, the therapist confirms that even if suffering seems atrocious and the confusing mismatch, it's okay. The mismatch is part of life. The storm is a symptom of a primitive state, a reflex of the body in the face of the frustration of their emotional needs - they are proximity or removal. It is a state in which rational thinking is overshadowed by instinctive reaction. It can manifest itself as a struggle or escape, as if the partner were a predator, or as avoidance, an attempt to protect himself from a partner who seems to consume the little emotional energy that remains. Ultimately, the way we react to mismatch is linked to the way we deal with the affective bond. Regardless of the therapeutic approach used, all psychotherapeutic schools converge on this essential strategy: to make these internal mechanisms obvious. From this awareness, therapy helps the couple create new emotional "dances", promoting understanding and empathy to make the mismatch less destructive. Of course, there are couples who come to therapy at a point where the therapeutic space serves to prepare divorce or separation. In such cases, the mediation offered by the therapist allows them to maintain forms of communication based on respect. Many therapists “divorce” couples, and this is also a successful result. The stigma associated with therapy in general is a barrier. In addition to sporadic romantic dinner, or quality time together, which many therapists will surely prescribe, therapy aims to go to other sites. Investing in relationship is essential for love, either through therapy or honest conversations about the couple's dynamics. Because love does not simply happen, it survives between comfort, pleasure and conflict.

item.title: Geogostronomy and the role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau
item.description: (continuation) Kitchen chiefs are increasingly experiencing melting dishes that incorporate international flavors, remaining faithful to Portuguese roots. The emergence of new gastronomic trends, such as “farm-to-table” and sustainable cuisine, reflects the growing awareness of the origin and quality of food. Social networks have also transformed the way culinary experiences are shared and perceived. Platforms like Instagram have made it easier for bosses to show their dishes to a global audience, attracting food enthusiasts and contributing to the promotion of macanese cuisine. Through visually appealing presentations, bosses may involve customers and encourage the appreciation of intricate flavors of Luso-Macaense cuisine. Several academic analyzes of Macau's geogostronomic landscape reveal the complex interaction between culture and food. Scholars emphasize the concept of identity, illustrating how culinary practices reflect the cultural heritage and values ​​of the community. The mix of Portuguese and Chinese culinary traditions creates a distinct identity for Macao, reinforcing its position as a cultural cauldron. The investigation suggests that gastronomic experiences are vital to fostering a sense of belonging among residents and promoting community ties. The culinary events and festivals that celebrate Luso-Macaense gastronomy further reinforce the community's involvement and promote a shared cultural identity, encouraging pride in local traditions and values. The role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau is ready for continuous evolution. The growing awareness of consumers for sustainability and health will probably shape culinary trends. Kitchen heads may prioritize the use of local and organic ingredients, while exploring innovative cooking techniques that honor traditional practices. Promoting educational programs that emphasize the importance of culinary heritage can help ensure that future generations enjoy and continue the tradition of Portuguese gastronomy. By promoting connections between chefs and consumers, Macau can maintain his unique cuisine in a constantly changing global landscape. The role of Portuguese gastronomy in Macau serves as a rich example of how cultural and geographical factors intertwine to shape culinary practices. As Macau sails for contemporary influences and anticipates future developments, the essence of Portuguese cuisine continues to prosper and evolve, promising a vibrant and dynamic culinary future. The evolution of macanese culinary culture is also influenced by the change in consumer habits and globalization. The increase in gastronomic tourism in Macao led to a greater interest in traditional dishes, as visitors eager for experiencing local flavors exploit the gastronomic landscape. Restaurants can respond by raising traditional recipes to exquisite gastronomic experiences. Events such as the “International Festival of Cities of Gastronomy, Macao” also promotes the appreciation for local cuisine, drawing attention to the skills of local bosses and the importance of culinary heritage. In recent years, conscious effort has been assisted to preserve traditional methods, simultaneously integrating modern techniques and global influences. The introduction of elements such as molecular gastronomy begins to be a practice in various luxury restaurants in Macao, creating a new dialogue between traditional dishes and contemporary food science. These innovative approaches challenge the notion of authenticity, suggesting that tradition is not static but dynamic. While there are purists who advocate the preservation of original revenues, others advocate a reinterpretation that reflects contemporary food and preferences. The sustainability of Macanese cuisine in the modern context is another critical area to examine. Environmental awareness began to influence culinary practices, with an increasing emphasis on the use of local ingredients. This change improves the freshness of foods served in Macanese restaurants. Establishments are increasingly highlighting their commitment to ecological practices and can integrate in their sustainable seafood menus and organic vegetables. These practices ensure that although the kitchen remains rooted in its historical context, it continues to evolve in a sustainable way. In addition, the intersection of global trends had an impact on Macao's traditional culinary landscape. The global fascination with the melting kitchen encouraged bosses to experience unconventional combinations. This mixture of culinary traditions can be seen in the popularity of dishes such as the Macaense-Taieman lobster curry or almond cookies influenced by Portuguese and Chinese pastry techniques. These developments reflect the evolution of the taste of both local inhabitants and tourists, reflecting a broader culinary narrative that challenges traditional concepts of what constitutes macanese food. The future of Macanese cuisine seems promising, characterized by continuous exploration of identity, innovation and cultural exchange. As the culinary scene evolves, it is crucial that chiefs and gastronomy enthusiasts find a balance between respect for traditional methods and the adoption of new techniques. The potential for greater international recognition remains strong, particularly in the field of exquisite restoration, where macanese flavors can be presented with modern interpretations. However, challenges persist, namely as regards the preservation of authentic culinary practices. Discussions may arise around cultural appropriation as macanese dishes gain popularity and are adapted to various culinary contexts. The challenge lies in ensuring the maintenance of the integrity of traditional dishes and, at the same time, interacting effectively with a global audience. This dialogue enhances the delicate balance between adaptation and authenticity in culinary heritage. Macau's Portuguese cuisine represents a rich tapestry of flavors formed through centuries of cultural exchange, innovation and adaptation. The historical context provides a basis for understanding how these diverse influences intertwined, leading to a distinct culinary identity. Influential heads have defended this kitchen, ensuring its relevance in modern gastronomy, while sustainability efforts aim to keep it linked to local traditions. The interaction between tradition and modernity, authenticity and innovation will continue to shape the future of Macanese cuisine. The enthusiasm surrounding this culinary landscape promises to attract global interest, immortalizing the flavors and narratives that define this unique gastronomic heritage.

item.title: Young Timorese wants to be the best chef and expand cooking in the country
item.description: The Timorense Melquirudi da Cunha began cooking with his mother and today tries to realize the dream of being the best chief cooking of Timor-Leste and promoting the traditional gastronomy of his country in the world. The 19-year-old studies cooking at the Timor-Leste Development Agency (ETDA), where he told Lusa, "he gained more interest and passion for gastronomy." It was through that formation center that Melqui, diminutive by which he is known, represented the country in the international competition of young cook, which took place in early February in India, accompanied by his mentor, Marcelino Freitas. “Although Timor-Leste has not reached a high classification, we learned many things. How to better manage the time, use ingredients properly and to have dishes correctly, ”explained Melqui. “I also learned a lot from the exchange of experiences with heads from other countries and highlighted traditional Timor-Leste dishes to promote our country's products at the international level,” said the young man. To India, Melqui took a Timor-Leste coffee pudding, considered one of the best in the world, and “Kulu Bafa”, coconut-cooked bread fruit, a traditional dish from the municipality of Baucau. "They were impressed with the taste and the fact that they never experienced them before," he said. The young man, who wants to be one of the “best heads of Timor-Leste”, also intends to promote the country's gastronomy and his traditional dishes such as “Tukir”, a bamboo trunk, and “Saboko”, spicy fish. Nutritional problems Despite a rich and nutritious kitchen, data from the world food program report that 47 percent of children in the country under 5 are growth compromised, 8.6 percent suffer from acute malnutrition and 23 percent of women of reproductive age (between 15 and 49 years) have anemia. Asked about the reasons for the Timorese not to have a healthy diet, mentor and chef Marcelino Freitas said one of the reasons is increasingly consuming imported products instead of places. “If we look at the conditions and the situation of Timor-Leste we see that the country is full of local products. We talk about poor nutrition in Timor, but we consume, mostly, foods imported from other countries, which often contain sugar and excess fat, ”said the cook and also a trainer ETDA. “We have a lot of healthy foods, but we still don't know how to use them correctly. Therefore, from now on, it is essential to develop a more productive thinking, ”he said. According to Marcelino Freitas, the Timorese have to eat more sweet potatoes, cassava, and yams and other traditional foods and also learn to innovate and turn the way food cooks. The trainer also stressed that local products are rich in quality proteins, essential for healthy eating. "The challenge now is to turn these foods to be healthier and can respond to individual and community needs," he said, appealing to the appreciation of local products so that people can have a better physical condition and more balanced health.

item.title: Photography | Known Sony World Photography Awards finalists
item.description: The finalists of the new edition of the Sony World Photography Awards are already known, considered the most prestigious awards in the sector. The distinctions, including in the “Photographer of the Year” category, will be known on April 16 at a ceremony in London. According to a statement, the “photographic projects were recognized by the technical domain and an original approach to the narrative”, being the finalists presented in an exhibition at Somerset House, patent from April 17 to May 5 this year. There are thus 30 finalists in this 18th edition, of which will result in ten winners, and more than 419 thousand images from over 200 countries and regions were subjected to contest. One of the highlights of this edition of Awards is the creation of a new category, the “Japan Professional Prize”, which highlights “the creativity and dynamism of the contemporary photographic scene of Japan” and “recognizes a winner and a restricted list of impressive series of Japanese photographers”. Monica Allende, president of the Sony awards jury, said the team was "impressed by the strength and variety of works submitted in 2025. "Documentary Projects" includes the work of Frenchman Alex Bex, with "Memories of Dust", which "explores the visual vocabulary of a train, considering new forms of presentation of the male archetype."

item.title: FDC accepts applications for film and television financing
item.description:
The Culture Development Fund (FDC) accepts applications by the end of this month for the first round of candidates for the “Macao Cinematographic and Television Subsidy Plan”, and this private project financing initiative will have four candidacy rounds. The objectives, according to a FDC note, are "to promote the image of Macao, encourage abroad teams for filming in Macau and increase the international prestige of masters through cinematic and television works." Projects will be accepted for competition driven by a foreign filming team that include filming in Macao not less than three days. Another of the conditions is that this project may not have had any part filmed in the territory "before the confirmed presentation date." In addition, “applications must be presented by local commercial entrepreneurs”, ie “production units in Macao whose activities must be related to film production and television”.
Up to two million Another of the rules of the contest is that during the financial support period the public display of the project should be completed, and "the duration of the same and the places of Macao that served as a scenario must comply with the requirements presented". Regarding subsidies, will be granted up to a maximum limit of 30 to 40 percent of the budgetary expenses designed for filming, in the maximum amount between 500 thousand and two million patacas. "The assessment will be made taking into account the effect of promotion on the image of Macau by the project, the scale of production and the popularity of channels of exhibition of the cinematic or television work", as well as "the level of participation of the Macao film and television sector." This Thursday will be organized a clarification session on this financing plan, from 15h, on the seventh floor of the Cheng Feng Shopping Center building, where the fund for the development of culture is located.

item.title: Banking | Increase deposits in January
item.description: In January, resident deposits at local banks rose slightly to 763.5 billion patacas, compared to December, according to information released by the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM). At the same time, non -resident deposits grew by 5.4 percent, having reached 314.4 billion patacas, compared to the previous month. In the same period, the total deposits of bank activity registered a growth of 1.4 percent, when compared to the previous month, having reached 1,290.3 billion patacas. Most deposits were in Hong Kong dollars, with a proportion of 46.2 percent, followed by US dollars deposits, with a proportion of 24.5 percent, and 20 percent. Renminbis deposits represented 7.5 percent of the total. Also in January, internal loans to the private sector decreased 0.5 percent compared to the previous month, to 513.8 billion patacas. item.title: Game growth should reach 6.5 percent throughout the year
item.description: Corrector Seport Research Partners estimates that the game's revenues will grow 6.5 percent throughout this year, which would mean a value of 241 billion patacas. The estimates are included in a report from Seport Research Partners, quoted by the GGR Asia portal. "We foresee that the growth of gross game revenues in 2025 is approximately 6.5 percent in annual terms, with higher growth in the second half of the year," the report signed by Vitaly Umnsky. "Growth should be driven by increasing operators' marketing efforts and improving consumer confidence in China," he was added. The document appears days after it was revealed that the game's gross gross revenues grew 6.8 percent in February to 19.74 billion patacas. With the magnificent meetings to begin today, in Beijing, the analyst also admits to hope that policies of greater support to economic growth will be announced: "We hope that the policies resulting from the two sessions will highlight a position more favorable to growth than the last two years," he said. Vitaly Umansky also explained that the expectation is not the adoption of consumer subsidies inside, but rather by “additional stimuli” related to government expenses and policies to increase consumer expenses and private business activity. Positive month According to the same portal, the 6.8 percent growth of the game's recipes in February was also considered positive by JP Morgan Securities analysts, DS Kim, Selina Li and Mufan Shi. “Despite market concerns about poor Lunar New Year's performance, the game's gross recipes were strong in February and 7 percent increased to 19.7 billion, 6 percent above consensus,” was highlighted in a report to investors issued on Sunday. However, for this investment bank growth throughout the year will be more moderate: "This number makes us feel quite comfortable about consensus on the growth of 2 to 3 percent of the game's recipes over 2025," they stressed.

item.title: Lake Building | Investigation for security devices
item.description:
Faced with the complaints of residents that the fire alarm did not touch, the deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen calls for an investigation to the security of social housing, as well as an intensification of inspections in all macau buildings
Representative Lo Choi in appealed to the government to conduct an investigation to the state of fire safety equipment in the lake building, after last week's fire that forced the withdrawal of 20 people. The subject is addressed through written interpellation, in which the Jiangmen community legislator stresses that residents did not hear the alarms and fire. Information on problems with fire equipment had been reported on the day of the flames outbreak, but was also confirmed by the deputy's office. “Our service sent staff to the place to understand the situation. Residents of the same building, as well as those in the neighborhood, told us that they did not hear any suspicious alarm sound during the fire, ”he said. "From this incident, it is possible to find that the building company management may have disabilities in the management of its firefighting equipment, having even failed to provide timely information and correct guidelines to firefighters during the incident," he added. In the face of this scenario, Lo Choi In asks for the intervention of the authorities: "Has the government already intended the way the management is done in the building where the fire took place?" He asked. “Regarding problems with security equipment at the fire site, does the government intend to launch an investigation to the succeeded, to investigate management deficiencies?” He asked. Deeper problems Lo Choi In also highlighted that the problems of safety equipment in the buildings of Macau are not uncommon and recalled the case in Areia Preta in 2019, with the Jardim Kong Fok Cheong building. "It was known that, at that time, the management of the building was extremely disabled, because the gates of the fuzz of many floors were seriously damaged, the extinguishers had expired 10 years ago, the lighting of emergency exits did not work correctly and the stairs of the floors were full of various objects," said the deputy. "Worse yet, when the fire broke out, not only the building's fire alarm system did not sound, but also the fires water supply system failed, it was difficult to put out the fire for a while in the absence of water supply, but fortunately, the neighbors called each other at that time," he added. Given these recurring problems, the deputy wants to know if the government will intensify the supervision of different buildings and oblige the condominiums to meet security requirements.

item.title: Death | Died businessman Jorge Ferro Ribeiro
item.description: Jorge Ferro Ribeiro, chairman of the Board of Directors of the Geocapital Investment Company and Stanley Ho's historic partner, died on Saturday, in Herdade in Mountain, according to information from Jornal Económico. According to the publication the investor and representative of the interests of Stanley Ho in Portugal, Jorge Ferro Ribeiro was president of the company Construções Technicals, which also operated in Macau, and Interfina, a group with various businesses, including consulting and management. Geocapital presented Macau and its investors to companies from other countries, and also tried to bring the various companies in these countries closer, using their calls. item.title: Economic Housing | Put up with 3,000 apartments
item.description:
The first group of families selected to buy an economic housing apartment from the 2019 contest begins today to choose the fractions. The Housing Institute will give buyers time to contract loans, and it is not necessary to make payments at the time of signing the contract
The houses have been ready since September 2024, adding three economic housing buildings in zone A of the new landfills, and from today they can be chosen by the families selected in the public tender that started in 2019. This contest, the last held under the former “Economic Housing Law”, ended last week with the selection of 2,993 candidates for the Housing Institute (IH). The apartments that will be chosen are located in zone A of the new landfills. There are, in total, 3,017 fractions distributed by three buildings: the Tong Seng Building (Lot B4), Tong Chong Building (Lot B9) and the Tong Kai building (lot B10). Separating by typology, the aggregates selecting by IH can choose from 760 T1, 1,000 T2 and 1,257 apartments of T3 typology. According to information released yesterday by IH, the body is notifying, by groups, the qualified family aggregates of the Economic Housing Contest on the choice of fractions, with the first group to be called today to the IH headquarters to choose the apartments. As it should be In addition to notifications, IH is sending offices about the choice of fractions, accompanied by tables with sales prices. It is recalled that the average sale price of the fractions to the lots in question is around 35,600 patacas per square meter. In addition, buyers cannot sell the houses for a period of 16 years, and after this deadline has to compensate the IH, "the ratio being boned between 60 and 70 percent." After choosing the apartments, candidates sign the promissory contract of purchase and sale of properties, as well as related documents. “At the time of signing the promissory contract, no payment is required. HI will book enough time to treat formalities related to mortgage loans by their household aggregates, ”said IH. Once the loans are contracted, buyers are notified to “pay the housing amounts and the treatment of formalities related to the reception of the keys of the fractions,” added the IH. Selected candidates can consult on the official IH page the various models and prices of the apartments, or visit the model floors in the Mong Tak building of Mong's Social Housing there, to know “typologies and materials used” in the fractions.

item.title: GDP | Macao economy grew 8.8% in 2024
item.description:
Macao Gross Domestic Product grew 8.8 percent by 2024 compared to the previous year, supported by the increase in the game industry and internal demand. On the other hand, the government's expense descended 5.1 percent of 2023, with the end of consumer cards
Gross Domestic Product (GDP) reached, last year, 403.3 billion patacas, "equivalent to 86.4 percent of the economic volume of the year 2019," said the direction of statistics and censuses (DSEC) in a statement on Friday. The value of GDP at the end of last year represented an annual growth of 8.8 percent compared to 2023. "Export of services and internal demand (including private consumer expense, government's final consumer consumer expense grew 9.2 and 2.3 percent, respectively, in annual terms," ​​reads the same note. Regarding the growth of service exports, DSEC highlights the impetus given by the annual increase of 23.8 percent of the number of visitors entries in 2024. The determining factor for the positive evolution of GDP was the 21.8 percent increase in game service exports over last year. Growth that contrasted with annual descent of 6.1 percent of exports of other tourist services, "due to the basis of relatively high comparison of the year 2023". Still, in this chapter, the 2024 record represented a growth of 13 per 2019. The DSEC also mentioned that foreign trade in goods and exports and imports of goods fell last year, respectively, 14.5 and 7.6 percent, when a 2023 comparison. Also according to the data, private consumption increased by 4.9 percent, in annual terms, “thanks to the continuing recovery of economic activities and the uninterrupted labor market stability”. DSEC also revealed that “the GDP per capita, which measures the average value of the goods and services produced per person, was 587,922 patacas”, which represents a 7.6 percent increase compared to 2023. The other side In the opposite direction, the government's expense fell, in the period under analysis, 5.1 percent, after the end of economic support measures, launched to relieve the impact of the pandemic, with the DSEC to highlight the consumption card rounds released by 2023. In the public sector, the investment in equipment rose 1.2 percent, compared to 2023, while the investment in construction fell 10 percent, “due to the completion of part of the large public works”, reads in the note. With regard to private, investment in equipment grew 31.1 percent and under construction rose 5.1 percent in annual terms. In the last quarter of 2024, Macau GDP increased 3.4 percent, compared to the same period of 2023. DSEC stressed that internal demand and exports of services had homologous additions of 2.8 and 2.1 percent, respectively. João Luz / Lusa
